germany.name: Germany
germany.description: Well-known as one of the major aggressors of World War Two, Germany revolutionized mobile warfare in a way never seen before. Germany relies on hard infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

japan.name: Japan
japan.description: Opportunists and expansionists during, the Japanese seized as many valuable resources and as much land as they could early in the war. Japan relies on both veteran trained marine and paratrooper units as well as some light but reliable vehicles.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

finland.name: Finland
finland.description: While originally attempting to remain neutral, Finland was introduced to the war when they were invaded by the Soviet Union, a significantly stronger force. The Finnish use encirclement and stealth tactics to outsmart and outflank their foes before they can correctly respond.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

united_states.name: United States
united_states.description: The United States, while originally attempting to remain neutral, was suddenly attacked by the Japanese at pearl harbor and was forced to substantially ramp up production to begin fighting on both pacific and western fronts. The United States rely on mobile infantry units and weapons along with solid and reliable, yet numerous sherman tanks.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

soviet_union.name: Soviet Union
soviet_union.description: The Soviet Union, while biding its time before the inevitable German offensive, originally had major command and tactics issues. Later in the war, once they were in full swing, they were a very formidable and numerous force to be reckoned with. The Soviets rely on numerous infantry and heroic bravery to defeat their foes with sheer will.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

british.name: British
british.description: The British, while honoring previous treaties and agreements was forced to intervene in Germany's earliest battles. The British were eventually able to overcome their early defeats at the hands of the German forces with the help of their other allied counterparts. The British use a combination of capable armored vehicles, solid infantry and elite trained commando and SAS forces to defeat their enemies.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

france.name: France
france.description: France, still focused on their success in the first World War, placed heavy emphasis on static and sparse armored forces which were quickly overwhelmed by new German military tactics. The French continue to use first war trench fighting and artillery tactics to defeat their enemies.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

australia.name: Australia
australia.description: Australia fought alongside the allies in many important battles, while also attempting to defend their homeland from a possible Japanese invasion. Australia relies on many armaments lent by the British as well as their own inspired troops to achieve victory.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

canada.name: Canada
canada.description: Beginning all the way in 1939, Canada supplied troops to the British Expeditionary forces to help the French in the defense of their homeland. Canada would go on to participate in many major offensives in the war such as the invasion of Normandy and the attack on the Rhineland. Canada primarily used British equipment supplemented with some of their own designs.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

hungary.name: Hungary
hungary.description: Starting with participation in the invasion of Yugoslavia, Hungary officially joined the Axis powers and later participated in the invasion of the Soviet Union. This would quickly turn to defeat as the Soviet Union later swept through and occupied parts of Hungary. The Hungarians relied on both German equipment and some home-developed arms and equipment such as their own unique tank designs.

infantry_focus.name: Infantry
infantry_focus.description: High quality infantry and anti-tank artillery.

airborne_focus.name: Airborne
airborne_focus.description: Airborne infantry and deceptive sabotage tactics.

armored_focus.name: Armored
armored_focus.description: Mechanized or motorized infantry and deadly armored vehicles.

tank_ace.name: Tank Ace
tank_ace.flavor: A tank ace is a fearsome foe to encounter on the battlefield.
tank_ace.description: Upgrade one Tank unit with Tank Ace.

inspiring_leader.name: Inspiring Leader
inspiring_leader.flavor: A leader who can motivate his/her men to keep fighting is a key asset.
inspiring_leader.description: Upgrade one Field Officer model with Inspiring Leader.

infantry_platoon.name: Infantry Platoon
infantry_platoon.description: A well-rounded force for taking on any opponent.

artillery_platoon.name: Artillery Platoon
artillery_platoon.description: A platoon focused on support units and heavy guns.

mechanized_platoon.name: Mechanized/Motorized Platoon
mechanized_platoon.description: A mobile force equipped with mechanized or motorized transports.

armored_platoon.name: Armored Platoon
armored_platoon.description: An armored force with supporting motorized or mechanized Infantry.

heat.name: HEAT
heat.description: Enemy units add 1 to rolls on any Damage Table(X) rules when hit by this weapon at Short range.

inspiring_leader.name: Inspiring Leader
inspiring_leader.description: This unit and friendly Infantry units within 6" get +1 Courage.

airdrop.name: Airdrop
airdrop.description:
This unit may be set aside in reserves before the match begins if all models have airdrop. At the beginning of any round after the first you may attempt to place the unit anywhere on the table over 9‚Äù away from enemy units.

Take a Courage test. If failed, use D10 scattering to determine the unit's new landing location. If the new location is off the table, place the unit at table edge as close as possible. If both players have units with Airdrop they must roll-off to see who deploys first, and then alternate in placing them.

fanatical.name: Fanatical
fanatical.description: This unit is treated as having +2 Courage for all break tests and does not gain shock from close combat.

tank_rider.name: Tank Rider
tank_rider.description: This model and its unit may be embarked on Vehicle unit with a save of 11+ as if it had Transport.

mounted_bicycle.name: Mounted(Bicycles)
mounted_bicycle.description: Increase this model's Movement by 2", but it may not use any weapons while mounted. This unit may spend 1 action to dismount from its Mount. A unit that has dismounted may no longer remount.

side_skirts.name: Side Skirts
side_skirts.description: This model gains +1 to its Save when hit in its side arcs from weapons with AP 4 or less.

gun_shield.name: Gun Shield
gun_shield.description: Friendly models gain +1 Save when targeted by attacks which cross this model.

smoke.name: Smoke
smoke.description: Choose a location on the battlefield within range of this weapon and if a hit is successful, place a 3" diameter smoke marker at the target location. If the weapon fires multiple shots and more than one lands on target, place any additional smoke markers in contact with the edge of the first hit. Smoke markers block line of sight and models inside or partially obscured by smoke markers gain the benefit of Soft Cover. At the end of the round, roll a D10 for each smoke marker. On a 5 or less the smoke marker is removed.

tracked.name: Tracked
tracked.description: This unit may ignore difficult terrain and low obstacles when moving.

amphibious.name: Amphibious
amphibious.description: This unit may treat impassable water terrain as difficult terrain.

salvo.name: Salvo
salvo.description: This weapon always hits at -1 Accuracy. When scattering results from this weapon, it hits the closest unit within 3" instead of just 1".

half_tracked.name: Half-Tracked
half_tracked.description: This unit may ignore difficult terrain when moving.

team.name: Team
team.description: This weapon requires X models to operate effectively. It suffers -1 Accuracy for each model under this number.

field_orders.name: Field Orders
field_orders.description:
When this unit is activated, choose up to X friendly _Infantry_ units within 6" to receive one of the following bonuses until the end of the round: 
 * Re-roll failed Accuracy tests of 9+ 
 * Re-roll failed Strength tests of 9+ 
 * +3" of Movement

no_retreat.name: No Retreat
no_retreat.description: When a friendly _Infantry_ unit within 6" fails a Courage test, that unit must remove one model to re-roll the test. This effect may be used once per _Infantry_ unit.

field_orders_armored.name: Armored Field Orders
field_orders_armored.description:
When this unit is activated, choose up to X friendly _Tank_ or _Armored Car_ units within 6" to receive one of the following bonuses: 
 * Re-roll failed Accuracy tests of 9+ 
 * Re-roll failed Strength tests of 9+ 
 * +3" of Movement

anti_infantry_mines.name: Anti-Infantry Mines
anti_infantry_mines.description: When an Infantry unit crosses this model, roll 7D10. On any rolls of 5 or less that unit takes a hit with AP4.

anti_tank_mines.name: Anti-Tank Mines
anti_tank_mines.description: When a Vehicle unit crosses this model, roll 3D10. On any rolls of 5 or less that unit takes a hit with AP7. The vehicle is treated as being hit in the Rear arc.

mixed_mines.name: Mixed Mines
mixed_mines.description: When an Infantry unit crosses this model, roll 5D10. On any rolls of 5 or less that unit takes a hit with AP4. When a Vehicle unit crosses this model, roll 2D10. On any rolls of 5 or less that unit takes a hit with AP7. The vehicle is treated as being hit in the Rear arc.

wire_cutters.name: Wire Cutters
wire_cutters.description: This model and its unit gain +3 to all Clear actions when attempting to clear barbed wire obstacles.

demolition_charges.name: Demolition Charges
demolition_charges.description: This model and its unit gain +3 to all Clear actions when attempting to barricade and defense obstacles.

mine_sweepers.name: Mine Sweepers
mine_sweepers.description: This model and its unit gain +3 to all Clear actions when attempting to clear mine fields.

repair_toolkit.name: Repair Toolkit
repair_toolkit.description: This model and its unit may spend one action to repair one vehicle within 3" that has suffered critical damage.

fighting_position_3.name: Fighting Position (Small)
fighting_position_3.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 3 models.

fighting_position_5.name: Fighting Position (Medium)
fighting_position_5.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 5 models.

fighting_position_7.name: Fighting Position (Large)
fighting_position_7.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 7 models.

wooden_bunker_4.name: Wooden Bunker (Small)
wooden_bunker_4.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 4 models.

woooden_bunker_8.name: Wooden Bunker (Medium)
woooden_bunker_8.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 8 models.

wooden_bunker_12.name: Wooden Bunker (Large)
wooden_bunker_12.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 12 models.

concrete_bunker_4.name: Concrete Bunker (Small)
concrete_bunker_4.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 4 models.

concrete_bunker_8.name: Concrete Bunker (Medium)
concrete_bunker_8.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 8 models.

concrete_bunker_12.name: Concrete Bunker (Large)
concrete_bunker_12.description: A group of fighting positions, each with a capacity of 12 models.

minefield_infantry.name: Anti-Infantry Minefield (6" Radius)
minefield_infantry.description: A minefield placed to keep infantry out.

minefield_tank.name: Anti-Tank Minefield (6" Radius)
minefield_tank.description: A minefield placed to keep tanks out.

minefield_mixed.name: Mixed Minefield (6" Radius)
minefield_mixed.description: A minefield placed to keep any enemies out.

recrew.name: Recrew
recrew.flavor: It's highly important to keep artillery pieces manned and fighting.
recrew.description: Use at the beginning of a round where an Infantry unit is within 2" of an Artillery unit. Remove X models from the Infantry unit and add restore X crew to the Artillery unit.

target_weak_point.name: Target Weak Point
target_weak_point.flavor: Exploiting weak points an an enemy's armor is key to taking out hard targets.
target_weak_point.description: Use before shooting with an Infantry or Artillery unit's weapon with AP 3 or higher. That attack is treated as hitting the target's side.

frag_out.name: Frag Out
frag_out.flavor: A volley of hand grenades can be quite effective at dealing with enemies in cover.
frag_out.description: Use before shooting with an Infantry unit that has Grenades (any type). That unit may throw 2 additional grenades.

armored_assault.name: Armored Assault
armored_assault.flavor: Occasionally armored units are used to push infantry and other units off a dug in position.
armored_assault.description: Use when a Vehicle unit declares a Charge action. It is treated as having Shock(+3) for that action.

improvised_tactics.name: Improvised Tactics
improvised_tactics.flavor: Sometimes it is necessary to improvise in an armored engagement in order to gain the edge.
improvised_tactics.description: Use when a Vehicle unit is attempting a reaction test. It is treated as having Initiative 9 for this test.

crew_repairs.name: Emergency Repairs
crew_repairs.flavor: In moments of dire circumstance crews may need to repair their vehicle in combat.
crew_repairs.description: Use when a Vehicle unit is activated. That unit may repair one critical damage caused by a penetrating hit.

combat_drop.name: Combat Drop
combat_drop.flavor: A well-trained paratroop unit can drop as close as possible to their intended target.
combat_drop.description:
Set one Infantry, Artillery or Airborne Vehicle unit aside in reserves before the match begins. At the beginning of any round after the first you may attempt to place the unit anywhere on the table over 12" away from enemy units.

Take a Courage test. If failed, use D10 scattering to determine the unit's new landing location. If the new location is off the table, place the unit at table edge as close as possible. If both players have units with Airdrop they must roll-off to see who deploys first, and then alternate in placing them.

tough_fighters.name: Tough Fighters
tough_fighters.flavor: Some of the toughest units to fight in a close combat brawl are trained Airborne units.
tough_fighters.description: Use before an Infantry unit uses a fight action. Its attacks gain AP1.

stealth_tactics.name: Stealth Tactics
stealth_tactics.flavor: Moving quickly and quietly is a key part of Airborne training.
stealth_tactics.description: Use when activating an Infantry unit. It may make a free 6" move action and may not be targeted by reaction fire when doing so.

regroup.name: Regroup
regroup.flavor: Sometimes it is best to regroup remaining soldiers before making another push.
regroup.description: Use before activating an Infantry unit within 2" of another of the same unit. The two units merge and, for the rest of the battle, they are counted as a single unit for all rules purposes. This may not bring a unit above its maximum size.

reinforcements.name: Reinforcements
reinforcements.flavor: With such a quantity of manpower, many fighting soldiers are available.
reinforcements.description: Once per game, at the end of any round, you may remove one _Infantry_ unit from the table and place it back within 6" of any table edge with all models restored.

sacrifice.name: Strategic Sacrifice
sacrifice.flavor: Dying for such an important cause is sometimes necessary to win a battle.
sacrifice.description: Use when an _Infantry_ or _Artillery_ unit is targeted by a Shooting attack. Half the hits (rounded down) from that weapon (after adding any additional hits from effects) may be moved to another target _Infantry_ unit within 3".
